q1: What types of PDF protection can be removed?
a1: The tool can remove both user passwords (required to open the PDF) and owner passwords (that restrict editing, printing, or copying). You must know the password to unlock the file.
a2: Yes, as long as you have the right to access the PDF. This tool is designed for users who know the password but want to remove it for convenience. Never use it on files you do not own.
q3: Will the PDF content be changed?
a3: No. The tool only removes the password protection. All content, formatting, images, and metadata remain exactly the same.
